trans-unit.source: Get started with Stream Analytics: Real-time fraud detection | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Stream Analytics: Real-time fraud detection | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a real-time fraud detection solution with Stream Analytics. Use an event hub for real-time event processing.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a real-time fraud detection solution with Stream Analytics. Use an event hub for real-time event processing.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create an end-to-end solution for real-time fraud detection with Azure Stream Analytics.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create an end-to-end solution for real-time fraud detection with Azure Stream Analytics.

trans-unit.source: Bring events into an Azure event hub, write Stream Analytics queries for aggregation or alerting, and send the results to an output sink to gain insight over data with real-time processing.
trans-unit.target: Bring events into an Azure event hub, write Stream Analytics queries for aggregation or alerting, and send the results to an output sink to gain insight over data with real-time processing.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A telecommunications company has a large volume of data for incoming calls.
trans-unit.target: A telecommunications company has a large volume of data for incoming calls.

trans-unit.source: The company needs the following from its data:
trans-unit.target: The company needs the following from its data:

trans-unit.source: Pare this data down to a manageable amount and obtain insights about customer usage over time and geographical regions.
trans-unit.target: Pare this data down to a manageable amount and obtain insights about customer usage over time and geographical regions.

trans-unit.source: Detect SIM fraud (multiple calls coming from the same identity around the same time but in geographically different locations) in real-time so that they can easily respond by notifying customers or shutting down service.
trans-unit.target: Detect SIM fraud (multiple calls coming from the same identity around the same time but in geographically different locations) in real-time so that they can easily respond by notifying customers or shutting down service.

trans-unit.source: In canonical Internet of Things (IoT) scenarios there is a ton of telemetry or sensor data being generated – and customers want to aggregate them or alert over anomalies in real-time.
trans-unit.target: In canonical Internet of Things (IoT) scenarios there is a ton of telemetry or sensor data being generated – and customers want to aggregate them or alert over anomalies in real-time.

trans-unit.source: This scenario leverages an event generator located on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: This scenario leverages an event generator located on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Download it <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> and follow the steps in this tutorial to set up your solution.
trans-unit.target: Download it <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> and follow the steps in this tutorial to set up your solution.

trans-unit.source: The sample application will generate events and push them to an Event Hub instance for real-time processing.
trans-unit.target: The sample application will generate events and push them to an Event Hub instance for real-time processing.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Event Hubs are the preferred method of event ingestion for Stream Analytics and you can learn more about Event Hubs in <linkText>Azure Service Bus documentation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Event Hubs are the preferred method of event ingestion for Stream Analytics and you can learn more about Event Hubs in <linkText>Azure Service Bus documentation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create an Event Hub:
trans-unit.target: To create an Event Hub:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal click New > App Services > Service Bus > Event Hub > Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal click New > App Services > Service Bus > Event Hub > Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name, region, and new or existing namespace to create a new Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name, region, and new or existing namespace to create a new Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, each Stream Analytics job should read from a single Event Hub Consumer Group.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, each Stream Analytics job should read from a single Event Hub Consumer Group.

trans-unit.source: We will walk you through the process of creating a Consumer Group below, and you can <linkText>learn more about Consumer Groups</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: We will walk you through the process of creating a Consumer Group below, and you can <linkText>learn more about Consumer Groups</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create a Consumer Group, navigate to the newly created Event Hub and click the Consumer Groups tab, then click Create on the bottom of the page and provide a name for your Consumer Group.
trans-unit.target: To create a Consumer Group, navigate to the newly created Event Hub and click the Consumer Groups tab, then click Create on the bottom of the page and provide a name for your Consumer Group.

trans-unit.source: To grant access to the Event Hub, we will need to create a shared access policy.
trans-unit.target: To grant access to the Event Hub, we will need to create a shared access policy.

trans-unit.source: Click the Configure tab of your Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configure tab of your Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Under Shared Access Policies, create a new policy with Manage permissions.
trans-unit.target: Under Shared Access Policies, create a new policy with Manage permissions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Shared Access Policies where you can create a policy with Manage permissions.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Shared Access Policies where you can create a policy with Manage permissions.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Save at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Dashboard and click Connection Information at the bottom of the page, and then copy and save the connection information.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Dashboard and click Connection Information at the bottom of the page, and then copy and save the connection information.

trans-unit.source: We have provided a client application that will generate sample incoming call metadata and push it to Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: We have provided a client application that will generate sample incoming call metadata and push it to Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to set up this application.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to set up this application.

trans-unit.source: Download the TelcoGenerator solution from <linkText>https://github.com/Azure/azure-stream-analytics/tree/master/DataGenerators/TelcoGenerator</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Download the TelcoGenerator solution from <linkText>https://github.com/Azure/azure-stream-analytics/tree/master/DataGenerators/TelcoGenerator</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Replace the Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectionString and EventHubName values in App.Config with your Event Hub connection string and name.
trans-unit.target: Replace the Microsoft.ServiceBus.ConnectionString and EventHubName values in App.Config with your Event Hub connection string and name.

trans-unit.source: Build the solution to trigger the download of required nuget packages.
trans-unit.target: Build the solution to trigger the download of required nuget packages.

trans-unit.source: Start the application.
trans-unit.target: Start the application.

trans-unit.source: The usage is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The usage is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following example will generate 1000 events with a 20 percent probability of fraud over the course of 2 hours.
trans-unit.target: The following example will generate 1000 events with a 20 percent probability of fraud over the course of 2 hours.

trans-unit.source: You will see records being sent to your Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: You will see records being sent to your Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Some key fields that we will be using in this real-time fraud detection application are defined here:
trans-unit.target: Some key fields that we will be using in this real-time fraud detection application are defined here:

trans-unit.source: Record
trans-unit.target: Record

trans-unit.source: Definition
trans-unit.target: Definition

trans-unit.source: CallrecTime
trans-unit.target: CallrecTime

trans-unit.source: Timestamp for the call start time.
trans-unit.target: Timestamp for the call start time.

trans-unit.source: SwitchNum
trans-unit.target: SwitchNum

trans-unit.source: Telephone switch used to connect the call.
trans-unit.target: Telephone switch used to connect the call.

trans-unit.source: CallingNum
trans-unit.target: CallingNum

trans-unit.source: Phone number of the caller.
trans-unit.target: Phone number of the caller.

trans-unit.source: CallingIMSI
trans-unit.target: CallingIMSI

trans-unit.source: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI).
trans-unit.target: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI).

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the caller.
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the caller.

trans-unit.source: CalledNum
trans-unit.target: CalledNum

trans-unit.source: Phone number of the call recipient.
trans-unit.target: Phone number of the call recipient.

trans-unit.source: CalledIMSI
trans-unit.target: CalledIMSI

trans-unit.source: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI).
trans-unit.target: International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI).

trans-unit.source: Unique identifier of the call recipient.
trans-unit.target: Unique identifier of the call recipient.

trans-unit.source: Now that we have a stream of telecommunications events, we can set up a Stream Analytics job to analyze these events in real-time.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have a stream of telecommunications events, we can set up a Stream Analytics job to analyze these events in real-time.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click New > Data Services > Stream Analytics > Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click New > Data Services > Stream Analytics > Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values, and then click Create Stream Analytics Job:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values, and then click Create Stream Analytics Job:

trans-unit.source: Job Name: Enter a job name.
trans-unit.target: Job Name: Enter a job name.

trans-unit.source: Region: Select the region where you want to run the job.
trans-unit.target: Region: Select the region where you want to run the job.

trans-unit.source: Consider placing the job and the event hub in the same region to ensure better performance and to ensure that you will not be paying to transfer data between regions.
trans-unit.target: Consider placing the job and the event hub in the same region to ensure better performance and to ensure that you will not be paying to transfer data between regions.

trans-unit.source: Storage Account: Choose the Azure storage account that you would like to use to store monitoring data for all Stream Analytics jobs running within this region.
trans-unit.target: Storage Account: Choose the Azure storage account that you would like to use to store monitoring data for all Stream Analytics jobs running within this region.

trans-unit.source: You have the option to choose an existing storage account or to create a new one.
trans-unit.target: You have the option to choose an existing storage account or to create a new one.

trans-unit.source: Click Stream Analytics in the left pane to list the Stream Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: Click Stream Analytics in the left pane to list the Stream Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Stream Analytics service icon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Stream Analytics service icon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The new job will be shown with a status of Created.
trans-unit.target: The new job will be shown with a status of Created.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the Start button on the bottom of the page is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the Start button on the bottom of the page is disabled.

trans-unit.source: You must configure the job input, output, and query before you can start the job.
trans-unit.target: You must configure the job input, output, and query before you can start the job.

trans-unit.source: In your Stream Analytics job click Inputs from the top of the page, and then click Add Input.
trans-unit.target: In your Stream Analytics job click Inputs from the top of the page, and then click Add Input.

trans-unit.source: The dialog box that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your input.
trans-unit.target: The dialog box that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your input.

trans-unit.source: Select Data Stream, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select Data Stream, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Select Event Hub, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select Event Hub, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values on the third page:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values on the third page:

trans-unit.source: Input Alias: Enter a friendly name for this job input such as CallStream.
trans-unit.target: Input Alias: Enter a friendly name for this job input such as CallStream.

trans-unit.source: Note that you will be using this name in the query later.
trans-unit.target: Note that you will be using this name in the query later.

trans-unit.source: Event Hub: If the Event Hub you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select the namespace that the event hub is in.
trans-unit.target: Event Hub: If the Event Hub you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select the namespace that the event hub is in.

trans-unit.source: If your event hub is in a different subscription, select Use Event Hub from Another Subscription and manually enter information for Service Bus Namespace, Event Hub Name, Event Hub Policy Name, Event Hub Policy Key, and Event Hub Partition Count.
trans-unit.target: If your event hub is in a different subscription, select Use Event Hub from Another Subscription and manually enter information for Service Bus Namespace, Event Hub Name, Event Hub Policy Name, Event Hub Policy Key, and Event Hub Partition Count.

trans-unit.source: Event Hub Name: Select the name of the Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Event Hub Name: Select the name of the Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Event Hub Policy Name: Select the event-hub policy created earlier in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Event Hub Policy Name: Select the event-hub policy created earlier in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Event Hub Consumer Group: Type the Consumer Group created earlier in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Event Hub Consumer Group: Type the Consumer Group created earlier in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: Event Serializer Format: JSON
trans-unit.target: Event Serializer Format: JSON

trans-unit.source: Encoding: UTF8
trans-unit.target: Encoding: UTF8

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the event hub.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the event hub.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics supports a simple, declarative query model for describing transformations for real-time processing.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics supports a simple, declarative query model for describing transformations for real-time processing.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the language, see the <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the language, see the <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will help you author and test several queries over your real-time stream of call data.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will help you author and test several queries over your real-time stream of call data.

trans-unit.source: To validate your query against actual job data, you can use the Sample Data feature to extract events from your stream and create a .JSON file of the events for testing.
trans-unit.target: To validate your query against actual job data, you can use the Sample Data feature to extract events from your stream and create a .JSON file of the events for testing.

trans-unit.source: The following steps show how to do this and we have also provided a sample <linkText>Telco.json</linkText><title></title> file for testing purposes.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show how to do this and we have also provided a sample <linkText>Telco.json</linkText><title></title> file for testing purposes.

trans-unit.source: Select your Event Hub input and click Sample Data at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select your Event Hub input and click Sample Data at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box that appears, specify a Start Time to start collecting data from and a Duration for how much additional data to consume.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box that appears, specify a Start Time to start collecting data from and a Duration for how much additional data to consume.

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to start sampling data from the input.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to start sampling data from the input.

trans-unit.source: It can take a minute or two for the data file to be produced.
trans-unit.target: It can take a minute or two for the data file to be produced.

trans-unit.source: When the process is completed, click Details and download and save the .JSON file that is generated.
trans-unit.target: When the process is completed, click Details and download and save the .JSON file that is generated.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Download and save processed data in a JSON file</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Download and save processed data in a JSON file</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to archive every event, you can use a passthrough query to read all the fields in the payload of the event or message.
trans-unit.target: If you want to archive every event, you can use a passthrough query to read all the fields in the payload of the event or message.

trans-unit.source: To start with, do a simple passthrough query that projects all the fields in an event.
trans-unit.target: To start with, do a simple passthrough query that projects all the fields in an event.

trans-unit.source: Click Query from the top of the Stream Analytics job page.
trans-unit.target: Click Query from the top of the Stream Analytics job page.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to the code editor:
trans-unit.target: Add the following to the code editor:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the name of the input source matches the name of the input you specified earlier.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the name of the input source matches the name of the input you specified earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click Test under the query editor.
trans-unit.target: Click Test under the query editor.

trans-unit.source: Supply a test file, either one that you created using the previous steps or use <linkText>Telco.json</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Supply a test file, either one that you created using the previous steps or use <linkText>Telco.json</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the check button and see the results displayed below the query definition.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button and see the results displayed below the query definition.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Query definition results</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Query definition results</linkText>

trans-unit.source: We'll now pare down the returned fields to a smaller set.
trans-unit.target: We'll now pare down the returned fields to a smaller set.

trans-unit.source: Change the query in the code editor to:
trans-unit.target: Change the query in the code editor to:

trans-unit.source: Click Rerun under the query editor to see the results of the query.
trans-unit.target: Click Rerun under the query editor to see the results of the query.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Output in query editor.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Output in query editor.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To compare the amount that incoming calls per region we'll leverage a <linkText>TumblingWindow</linkText><title></title> to get the count of incoming calls grouped by SwitchNum every 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: To compare the amount that incoming calls per region we'll leverage a <linkText>TumblingWindow</linkText><title></title> to get the count of incoming calls grouped by SwitchNum every 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Change the query in the code editor to:
trans-unit.target: Change the query in the code editor to:

trans-unit.source: This query uses the Timestamp By keyword to specify a timestamp field in the payload to be used in the temporal computation.
trans-unit.target: This query uses the Timestamp By keyword to specify a timestamp field in the payload to be used in the temporal computation.

trans-unit.source: If this field wasn't specified, the windowing operation would be performed using the time each event arrived at Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: If this field wasn't specified, the windowing operation would be performed using the time each event arrived at Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>"Arrival Time Vs Application Time" in the Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>"Arrival Time Vs Application Time" in the Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Note that you can access a timestamp for the end of each window by using the System.Timestamp property.
trans-unit.target: Note that you can access a timestamp for the end of each window by using the System.Timestamp property.

trans-unit.source: Click Rerun under the query editor to see the results of the query.
trans-unit.target: Click Rerun under the query editor to see the results of the query.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Query results for Timestand By</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Query results for Timestand By</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To identify potentially fraudulent usage we'll look for calls originating from the same user but in different locations in less than 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: To identify potentially fraudulent usage we'll look for calls originating from the same user but in different locations in less than 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: We <linkText>join</linkText><title></title> the stream of call events with itself to check for these cases.
trans-unit.target: We <linkText>join</linkText><title></title> the stream of call events with itself to check for these cases.

trans-unit.source: Change the query in the code editor to:
trans-unit.target: Change the query in the code editor to:

trans-unit.source: Click Rerun under the query editor to see the results of the query.
trans-unit.target: Click Rerun under the query editor to see the results of the query.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Query results of a join</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Query results of a join</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that we have defined an event stream, an Event Hub input to ingest events, and a query to perform a transformation over the stream, the last step is to define an output sink for the job.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have defined an event stream, an Event Hub input to ingest events, and a query to perform a transformation over the stream, the last step is to define an output sink for the job.

trans-unit.source: We'll write events for fraudulent behavior to Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: We'll write events for fraudulent behavior to Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to create a container for Blob storage if you don't already have one.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to create a container for Blob storage if you don't already have one.

trans-unit.source: Use an existing storage account or create a new storage account by clicking NEW > DATA SERVICES > STORAGE > QUICK CREATE and following the instructions.
trans-unit.target: Use an existing storage account or create a new storage account by clicking NEW > DATA SERVICES > STORAGE > QUICK CREATE and following the instructions.

trans-unit.source: Select the storage account, click CONTAINERS at the top of the page, and then click ADD.
trans-unit.target: Select the storage account, click CONTAINERS at the top of the page, and then click ADD.

trans-unit.source: Specify a NAME for your container and set its ACCESS to Public Blob.
trans-unit.target: Specify a NAME for your container and set its ACCESS to Public Blob.

trans-unit.source: In your Stream Analytics job click OUTPUT from the top of the page, and then click ADD OUTPUT.
trans-unit.target: In your Stream Analytics job click OUTPUT from the top of the page, and then click ADD OUTPUT.

trans-unit.source: The dialog box that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your output.
trans-unit.target: The dialog box that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your output.

trans-unit.source: Select BLOB STORAGE, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select BLOB STORAGE, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values on the third page:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values on the third page:

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT ALIAS: Enter a friendly name for this job output.
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT ALIAS: Enter a friendly name for this job output.

trans-unit.source: SUBSCRIPTION: If the Blob storage you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select Use Storage Account from Current Subscription.
trans-unit.target: SUBSCRIPTION: If the Blob storage you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select Use Storage Account from Current Subscription.

trans-unit.source: If your storage is in a different subscription, select Use Storage Account from Another Subscription and manually enter information for STORAGE ACCOUNT, STORAGE ACCOUNT KEY, CONTAINER.
trans-unit.target: If your storage is in a different subscription, select Use Storage Account from Another Subscription and manually enter information for STORAGE ACCOUNT, STORAGE ACCOUNT KEY, CONTAINER.

trans-unit.source: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Select the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Select the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: CONTAINER: Select the name of the container.
trans-unit.target: CONTAINER: Select the name of the container.

trans-unit.source: FILENAME PREFIX: Type in a file prefix to use when writing blob output.
trans-unit.target: FILENAME PREFIX: Type in a file prefix to use when writing blob output.

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: EVENT SERIALIZER FORMAT: JSON
trans-unit.target: EVENT SERIALIZER FORMAT: JSON

trans-unit.source: ENCODING: UTF8
trans-unit.target: ENCODING: UTF8

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Since a job input, query, and output have all been specified, we are ready to start the Stream Analytics job for real-time fraud detection.
trans-unit.target: Since a job input, query, and output have all been specified, we are ready to start the Stream Analytics job for real-time fraud detection.

trans-unit.source: From the job DASHBOARD, click START at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: From the job DASHBOARD, click START at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box that appears, select JOB START TIME and then click the check button on the bottom of the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box that appears, select JOB START TIME and then click the check button on the bottom of the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: The job status will change to Starting and will shortly move to Running.
trans-unit.target: The job status will change to Starting and will shortly move to Running.

trans-unit.source: Use a tool like <linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Azure Explorer</linkText><title></title> to view fraudulent events as they are written to your output in real-time.
trans-unit.target: Use a tool like <linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Azure Explorer</linkText><title></title> to view fraudulent events as they are written to your output in real-time.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Fraud detection: Fraudulent events viewed in real-time</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Fraud detection: Fraudulent events viewed in real-time</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For further assistance, try our <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For further assistance, try our <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get started using Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get started using Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale Azure Stream Analytics jobs</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale Azure Stream Analytics jobs</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference</linkText><title></title>
